title: massive lag spikes

replies.body:
I have the same issue, it is not my internet at all. Frankly it's anything but my internet, I have a steady 10.38mb/s download speed and an upload of 1.07. It's above average if anything. I disagree that these patches have had nothing to do with it, as over the patch 4 days my ping has been at a constant 383-792ms with only 2 games with normal 36ms. 
Also....WinMTR doesn't work for me, it says "cannot use Raw socket".

> WinMTR doesn't work for me, it says "cannot use Raw socket"

Sorry, it appears I accidentally linked to an old version of WinMTR in my post, please download the version from the updated link below. You may also need to run the tool as Admin or in compatibility mode if that doesn't help.

Hey there,

I don't think anything's changed in the last few patches that could be causing your game to become so unplayable. I believe it has to do with your internet connection.

Could you do the following for me and post back with the results

* Run the [ICSI Netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/) and link your results in a reply.
* Download [WinMTR](http://downloads.sourceforge.net/project/winmtr/WinMTR-v092.zip), run a traceroute to the following IP's (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes) and post the results in a reply here (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this)
   *  103.240.227.5
   * 103.240.227.25
* What ISP are you with? Do you experience this issue with any other games/services?
